name: Un Soir de Printemps
description:
•   Project done over the course of my game developer training (Interface 3)

This is my 2nd game in JavaScript, again using the Phaser 3 framework.

The game plays as a simple plaformer, where the aim was for my girlfriend to collect the objects (related to her) across the map (representing our opposite timezones) and unlock a "?" at the very end of the map. By walking over it, she then has the possibility to encode a password using the first letter of each object found, and unlock the secret message.

Cringy, I know, the things we do out of love...

Bugs: 

  1. No walls exist in this game. Which means if you walk outside the bounds of the map...... You better come back. There's really nothing else there, I promise.
  2. Clicking on the letters for the password can be laggy, so make sure you click thoroughly on each of the keys. Try again until something changes.
  3. The music sometimes takes a while to start. But it will eventually start (source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RZEPeyR4Z3g).
  4. Sometimes the last page won't appear after encoding the password. You just gotta refresh and try again....!
